notes: Use AP's counts and dates; present both the company's explanation and watchdog concerns.

sources.title: China approves 13 new Ivanka Trump trademarks in 3 months
China grants 16 additional Ivanka Trump trademarks (provisional approvals)

key_facts_confirmed: Trademark approvals raised conflict of interest concerns
sources.title: Ivanka Trump's Chinese trademarks raise questions about potential conflicts of interest

key_facts_confirmed: Detailed analysis of potential ethics violations
sources.outlet: Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington (CREW)
sources.title: Ivanka Trump's Chinese Trademarks: Conflicts of Interest Investigation

summary:
China's trademark office granted final approval for 13 Ivanka Trump trademarks over three
months in early 2018, and later provisionally approved 16 more in October 2018, according to
AP reviews of official records. The brand said filings were routine defensive registrations;
ethics groups cited conflict-of-interest risks given Ivanka Trump's government role.

Additional sources reveal that the trademark approvals coincided with sensitive US-China trade negotiations and potential policy decisions affecting Chinese companies, raising significant ethical concerns about potential improper influence.
title: China grants waves of Ivanka Trump trademarks as she serves in White House; ethics watchdogs flag conflicts
